issues.summary: Subutai resource hosts must support ARM processors.
issues.description:
Multiple architectures must be supported for the various embed IoT devices especially those based on ARM SoC's that will emerge. The aim here is to make it so Subutai can use these devices as resource hosts and thereby take advantage of the information they contain about their environment. Sensor networks are composed of small sensor devices that MAY intercommunicate and emit information about their environment. Sensor fusion is required to make sense via these devices. The problem is they have different architectures which requires additional architectures for at least our resource host operating system distribution.

It is necessary adding ARM-based image repositories (Paralella, Odroid) and requirements for this are:
* Parallella support
* on easy way to add other architechtures
* SS has to understand the changes related to this (ARM)
issues.creator: dilshat.aliev

issues.summary: Revise all places where Template Registry is accessed by external clients
issues.description:
We need to revise all places where template is used to enable support for template of multiple architectures. For this we need to revise these places:
1) Template Registry clients inside Subutai
2) Subutai CLI bindings that use Template Registry 
3) Subutai installation scripts registering templates with Templates Registry (/etc/init.d/service-interface)

We need to make sure that if architecture is properly supplied where possible without relying on default architecture determination on Subutai side
issues.creator: dilshat.aliev

issues.summary: As a users I want to be able to setup an ARM based Subutai Resource Host and create containers on it as they do on the x86_64 platform from ARM based images in snaps.
issues.description:
Users shall be able to setup an ARM based Subutai Resource Host and create containers on it as they do on the x86_64 platform from ARM based images in snaps. The same capabilities present for x86_64 should also be mirrored on the ARM platform. This means having ARM based snaps available for the image hierarchy in the snap repository. The repository must be able to support multiple architectures in this way.

There are many ARM SoC's which have their own kernels so there will not be one single ARM platform to support: there will be many.
issues.creator: kjoldoshbekova

issues.summary: The user should clearly be able to differentiate between ARM arch Resource Hosts on the Subutai Management Console.

issues.summary: Support Parallella/ODROID/Beagle Bone/Raspberry v2

*NOTE*: The Beagle Bone is already supported by Snappy so I think it might be very easy.
*NOTE*: Some NoSQL databases have issues on ARM 32-bit platforms so there will not be support for them like MongoDB which requires a 64-bit address space. No need to create snaps for their images.

issueWorkLogs.comment:
[https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/guides/oem/]{quote}Branding
Branding can be set in the form of a slogan and an image. snappy and it’s
webdm counterpart will use this information to brand the system accordingly.{quote}We can specify Branding information in our package
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
[https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/guides/oem/]{quote}The oem snappy package is a snappy package type that is used to setup and
personalize the system according to an OEM.
It covers a broad range, such as the software stack with its configuration and
hardware enablement.
There can only be one snappy package of type: oem and it can only be
installed during image provision.{quote}We can use Snappy Ubuntu OEM package for initial configuration of our image for ARM SoC.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
[https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/guides/oem/]{quote}dtb
The default dtb (device tree blob) can be overridden by a key entry point in
the package.yaml for the oem.
If a dtb is specified during provisioning, it will be selected as the dtb to
use for the system. If using an AB partition layout, when an update for the
oem package is installed which updates the dtb, the update will be
installed to the other partition and a reboot will be requested.{quote}We can ship device tree with oem snap. And it could be updated if required.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment: [https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/guides/oem/]{quote}The oem snap can provide a set of default packages to be installed during either provisioning or first boot. {quote}Seems like we can embed snap packages into image
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
[https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/guides/oem/]{quote}Bootloaders
Since each system boots differently, assets that are currently provided in flashassets of the device package can be provided in the oem snap instead.{quote}We can include bootloader assets in OEM snap.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment: [https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/start/]{quote}If you want to build against a local OEM snap, you need developer mode to disable signature verification:{quote}We can use local OEM snap package for building image.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment: Snappy Ubuntu OEM snap package allows us to set all required environment for SoC. We can specify U-Boot environment file, include device tree, set branding information. We will use this package for creating images for SoC.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issues.summary: BTRFS partition issue on Parallella
issues.description: Snappy Ubuntu that we use to run on Parallella by default has four primary disk partition - boot, system-a, system-b and writable. Partition table doesn't support more than four primary partitions, so we cannot just create another one, but to run Subutai we should have one extra partition for BTRFS volume. Find the way to create additional partition table in SD card for Snappy Subutai on Parallella
issues.creator: tzununbekov

issueWorkLogs.comment:
After some investigating we found out that we have two possible solutions: convert MBR to GPT or create extended partition on SD. 
Converting MBR to GPT probably is not possible without data loss so we have tried to create extended partition in place of writable partition. After tests we got the conclusion - this way fit our requirements and we will use it
issueWorkLogs.author: tzununbekov

issues.summary: Coordinate works on ARM support feature
issues.description:
In the course of implementing requirements for the next release, we need to coordinate works on ARM based RH support feature. We need to review and test the following hw boards:
# Parallela
# Odroid
# Raspberry v2
# Beagle Bone
If needed we shoud buy necessary hw and run tests. The ultimate goal is to be able to use at least one of the boards above as a Subutai Resource Host. To verify this we should be able at least to:
* Install Ubuntu or Ubuntu Snappy on the board
* Run Subutai go-agent
* Clone a container from a big data product template such as Hadoop as a part of an environment
* Setup networking and N2N

If these steps are done then we can conclude that the board can be used as a RH.
issues.creator: dilshat.aliev

issues.summary: Environment containers must be run under unprivileged user identities
issues.description: Presently containers in Subutai run as the root user. This is a big security hazard. The container should instead run as a non-root user with the identity of the environment, owned by some user. This prevents the potential of a user in a container gaining access as root in the resource host.
issues.creator: dilshat.aliev

issues.summary: Amazon EC2 instances must be usable as Subutai Resource Hosts
issues.description: Amazon is the IaaS cloud provider and perspective users of Subutai are going to want to use it perhaps even in a hybrid capacity to build out environments. To make the product competitive we must support the use of Amazon EC2 instances in some manner. Amazon's Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) should be leveraged by Subutai by enabling an Amazon EC2 instance to serve as a resource host. If this is not possible the new container based support that recently appeared at Amazon should be used to enable the creation of containers for environments on Amazon's infrastructure. In addition, for better interoperability with tools we should attempt to create an API or API adapter that can expose EC2 instance management interfaces for managing containers in Subutai. These features may not be possible to implement due to the nature of Amazon EC2's design however it is worth an attempt to increase the uptake of the product by potential users.
issues.creator: kjoldoshbekova

issues.summary: Reverse proxy must be implemented for enabling external clients to access internals of environments
issues.description: Applications running in environments MUST be accessible to the users outside of them. In most cases port 80 for HTTP and port 443 for HTTPS will be opened for access to the internal environment. The access also must be to the right containers in the right cluster within the environment.A reverse proxy capability is needed to be able to expose cloud environment applications to the world outside. Like Amazon security groups, this feature should expose a mechanism to route calls on HTTP and HTTPS to the proper cluster machines. This reverse proxy capability may need to handle more protocols other than HTTP. We will shoot definitely to implement the HTTP capability however handling all protocols may prove to be too difficult because the mechanisms to reverse proxy other protocols is highly protocol dependent. Research needs to be done to determine if some form of SDN based management can be leveraged to handle the multi-protocol reverse proxy mechanism to generalize it. In the end this may not be possible.
issues.creator: kjoldoshbekova

issues.summary: The Subutai UI must be redesigned to be lighter, more user-friendly, ergonomic and modern
issues.description:
The UI as it stands was created just to expose raw feature for testing purposes, NOT for the ease of use of a user. We are assembling a specific UI/UX team to address these issues of usability and to assist in this redesign. This will have a dramatic affect on users of the Subutai Product. Ease of use means greater adoption. The management console UI needs to be redesigned for usability and ergonomics so that just about anyone can use it. Secondly we've realized that the choice of UI components and frameworks are unnecessarily heavy. We would like to shrink this footprint down as much as possible so the management console gets lighter while being redesigned. This must be handled immediately before any press on the project and on the product are made or else the first impression will be very poor.

issues.summary: The security is greatly enhanced with targeted certificate based identities thereby reducing the threat of a compromise on all legs of control traffic used to orchestrate the environment across peers, resource hosts and container hosts.
issues.description: Right now we use SSL and TLS level security to create a secure channel for peer to peer communications. We also encrypt communications on REST interfaces and on MQTT transport layers. These are general encryption strategies. We would like to go further for additional security by encrypting message bodies from the source using the public key of the target identity and decrypting it using the private key of the target identity. This specifically encrypts messages passed between REST interfaces and MQTT interfaces from P2P, to P2-resource host down to the environment's containers. Also messages for environments at P2P boundaries will use the environment keys to communicate with peers instead of using peer keys. Again this makes encryption traffic specifically targeted.
issues.creator: dilshat.aliev

issues.summary: Refactor Environment Manager to setup N2N between peers during environment creation
issues.description:
We need to revise the implementation of Environment Manager to enable N2N network formation between peers during an environment creation across them.
The needed steps are:

1) Calculate available N2N IPs to assign to each peer (initiator peer does this). IPs must be unique across all participating peers
2) Assign N2N IPs to each peers and have them connect to initiator peer's super node by using "edge" command (initiator peer instructs remote peers to do that passing them N2N IP, super node IP, super node port, shared secret, community name). Community name can be formed for now like this: "subutai-${vni}" since vni is also unique. Shared secret is a random keyphrase
3) Add new property like Peer.getN2nIp(envId) which will hold the N2N IP assigned to environment
4) Refactor all calls to remote peers to use N2N IP  instead of external peer IP, except the calls that happen to form N2N network
5) If Peer external IP changes we need to notify all registered remote peers about that so that they can update their metadata.
6) Implement a way to rebuild existing N2N networks from initiator peer (iterate over existing environments) by rerunning "edge" command with new shared secret every N hours
issues.creator: dilshat.aliev

issues.summary: As an admin, I want to migrate Subutai to Snappy Ubuntu
issues.description:
To simplify installation process of Subutai, improve security and reduce size we need to migrate Subutai to Snappy Ubuntu.
Snappy Ubuntu Core is a new rendition of Ubuntu with transactional updates - a minimal server image with the same libraries as today’s Ubuntu, but applications are provided through a simpler mechanism.
The snappy approach is faster, more reliable, and lets us provide stronger security guarantees for apps and users — that’s why we call them “snappy” applications.
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issues.summary: Research the solutions for Snappy repository
issues.description: Research distributed file storage solution for Subutai snapps and templates repository
issues.creator: tzununbekov

issueWorkLogs.comment:
after getting into documentation and tests, I can say that Riak is most suitable solution for use. It has simple structure, do not need meta server, easily can manage cluster creation, add/remove node from cluster and has rich API, can work with commands from s3 and swift.

I will continue to build repository using it.
issueWorkLogs.author: bnuriddin

issueWorkLogs.comment:
I'm looking for object storage which we will use as repository and make integration for Kurjun, so we can have access control over it.

I'm looking for storage with caching ability, but not in-RAM solutions(that could act only as cache servers)
Stable at work with large files (up to 10Gb)
Simple distribution, cluster creation features.

At the same time it should be simple and light so we can run it in Subutai Management.

Current products that might fit our need:
* Riak S2
* Tarantool
* Infinispan
* Elliptics by Yandex
* Mongo (might work if configure)
* Mogile FS
* OCFS2 + DRDB (RAID over Network)
* CouchDB

issues.summary: Enable Open vSwitch on Snappy Subutai to fix reboot issue.
issues.description: Find a way to restore Subutai Management network after reboot: OVS, OpenFlow. Something like "system-interfaces" from Subutai on Ubuntu Server.
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
one of the way is adding lines in /apps/subutai-cli-mng/current/lib/net-ops  (it will run service-interface when openvswitch become available and run it once )


stat1=$(sudo ovs-ofctl dump-flows br-tun)
 
if [ "$stat1"  ]; then
  
if [ ! -f /tmp/sv-int ] ; then
 
/apps/subutai-cli-mng/current/etc/init.d/service-interface start
 
echo "Create /tmp/sv-int " >> /tmp/sv-log
 
touch /tmp/sv-int
 
fi
   
else echo "ovs-ofctl not active" >> /tmp/sv-log
 
fi
issueWorkLogs.author: aabdyldaev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
Another way is using systemd services:

create service file /writable/system-data/etc/systemd/system/almaz.service with content 
[Unit]
 
Wants=network.target network-online.target openvswitch_ovs-init-switch_0.1.service cloud-final.service openvswitch_ovs-init-db_0.1.service
 
After=multi-user.target network-target network-online.target openvswitch_ovs-init-switch_0.1.service openvswitch_ovs-init-db_0.1.service  
 
 
[Service]
 
ExecStart=/apps/subutai-cli-mng/current/etc/init.d/service-interface start
 
[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target


and enable service:

systemctl enable almaz.service

PS. here we need need to add command in file  ./service-interface "sleep 10" since we have :
sleep 5  in ovs-init.switch
sleep 2 in ovs-init.db
issueWorkLogs.author: aabdyldaev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
Below is code for autocreate service for restore OVS rules:


s2=$(systemctl is-enabled almaz.service)
if [ "$s2" = "enabled" ]; then
echo "almaz.service enabled" >> /tmp/almaz.service-status
else
echo "almaz.service dissabled" >> /tmp/almaz.service-status
pushd /writable/system-data/etc/systemd/system/
cat <<EOT > almaz.service
[Unit]
 
Wants=network.target network-online.target openvswitch_ovs-init-switch_0.1.service cloud-final.service openvswitch_ovs-init-db_0.1.service
 
After=multi-user.target network-target network-online.target openvswitch_ovs-init-switch_0.1.service openvswitch_ovs-init-db_0.1.service
 
 
[Service]
 
ExecStart=/apps/subutai-cli-mng/current/etc/init.d/service-interface start
 
[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
 
EOT
systemctl enable almaz.service
popd
fi
issueWorkLogs.author: aabdyldaev

issues.summary: Research containers monitoring
issues.description:
Collaborate with Subutai team to understand current state of monitoring system in Subutai. 
Find solutions to replace the old monitoring mechanism (crontab scripts + RRD) with something new (cadvisor + graphite?) with cool graphs and user-friendly interface.
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
Current monitoring implementation stores data in RRD-files in a single resource host only. RRD is pretty old and have a lot of unresolved problems. 
As we discussed with Subutai team we could replace RRD with any other system, but we need to save output format to prevent changing Subutai Management.
cAdvisor was looking interesting for collection performance data from containers. But after tests we found out that now it uses old (0.8) version InfuxDB to store metrics, but current recommended version is 0.9, which brings a huge changes to architecture of the system. Additionally cAdvisor aimed to monitor Docker containers, and stores data in not best for us format. That could brings some performance problems to monitoring system. 
It seems like the best choice for now is to collect data with our custom tools or scripts, store it newest InfuxDB 0.9. 
With using InfuxDB we could store data in distributed cluster, for failover and for improving performance. Additionally we could replace our graphs in Subutai Management with something more useful, like http://grafana.org/ 
Anyway we need to create additional issues for implementation monitoring cli with influxDB.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

for  Vbox, one of solution is to use "Host-only Adapter"  instead of bridge type.
1) enable dhcp server on vboxnet0
2) set NICS on MGMT1:
eth0   -> Host-Only Adapter  ->     vboxnet0
eth1   -> Internal network        ->  intnet
3) on RH-1:
eth0   ->  Internal network        ->  intnet
4) on MGMT2:
eth0   ->  Host-Only Adapter   ->   vboxnet0
eth1   -> Internal network  ->        intnet2
5) on RH-2:
eth0   ->  Internal network      ->    intnet2

issues.summary: Research snaps dependencies policy
issues.description: Now all our snaps independent and installed as frameworks. We need to research how we can use dependency in Snappy Ubuntu. Can frameworks be depended from frameworks or only apps have dependencies?
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
In current Snappy Ubuntu state there are two types of snap packages:
# Application;
# Framework.

As noted in Snappy docs ([https://developer.ubuntu.com/en/snappy/guides/frameworks/]) "Frameworks must not depend on other frameworks". Only application have special line in meta/package.yaml to specify list of frameworks, that required for this application. So we cannot use Snappy dependency for any our packages.

issues.summary: ActiveMQ does not accept agent connection.
issues.description: ActiveMQ sometime blocks agent connection with reporting "bad certificate". We need to investigate this situation and find solution to prevent this problem.
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
After investigation we found out that at the first start Management generates certificates using local time as certificate begin date. But, when system getting access to internet NTP service received date from network, and change it. 
The problem was with incorrect setting of UTC timezone, because by default VirtualBox set time based on host system. 
If we are using UTC in host system and Subutai server, we need to set following option in Virtual Box config: Setting->System->Motherboard->Hardware clock in UTC time. 
After that Subutai server will not set incorrect time based on NTP and wrong timezone.
issueWorkLogs.author: dshihovtsev

issues.summary: Investigate Snappy Subutai management crash on reboot
issues.description:
There is a bug in our Snappy Subutai management server. If after installation subutai-mng.snap do not wait initialization will be finished and reboot server, then after reboot management web interface does not work properly and shows 500 ERROR. 
Find out if we can fix management crash on reboot during initialization or find how could we fix it without reinstalling package.
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
we found that error 500 appeared if installation of second package begins before start of all karaf services, so solution is wait for services. And one of the way is like below:
1) install subutai-mng package
2) run and wait for script which will run peer-id-REST command and wait for response
if proper response returns, it means karaf is ready
3) install subutai snappy package
As a result we will have properly installed Subutai MGMT on Snappy UBuntu
issueWorkLogs.author: aabdyldaev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
changed  and testing installation with script below:

#!/bin/bash

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/ubuntu/curl
export PATH=$PATH:LD_LIBRARY_PATH

count=true
while [ "$count" = true ]; do

#run REST command with peer id request
myvar=$(/home/ubuntu/curl/curl http://localhost:8181/cxf/peer/id) 
echo "cheking myvar= $myvar"
  #if REST result not null
  if [  -z "$myvar" ]; then
  #check 
    echo "";
  else
    #we check that REST result is not error respond
    status=$(echo $myvar | grep "html")
      if [ -z "$status" ]; then
        count=false
      fi
  fi
sleep 5
done
issueWorkLogs.author: aabdyldaev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
finally we decided check installation process with command:
curl http://172.16.194.86:8181/cxf/peer/id
if output is Peer ID, it means installation of subutai-mng snappy package finished and we install subutai snapp package
issueWorkLogs.author: aabdyldaev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
draft code for packages installation:


#!/bin/bash

sudo snappy install --allow-unauthenticated  subutai-mng_0.0.1_all.snap

#since we dont have curl configured  on snappy we need to set paths to libs
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/ubuntu/curl
export PATH=$PATH:LD_LIBRARY_PATH

count=true
while [ "$count" = true ]; do

#run REST command with peer id request
myvar=$(/home/ubuntu/curl/curl http://localhost:8181/cxf/peer/id) 
echo "cheking myvar= $myvar"
  #if REST result not null
  if [ ! -z $myvar ]; then
    #we check that REST result is not error respond
    status=$(echo $myvar | grep "html")
      if [ -z $status ]; then
        count=false
      fi
  fi
sleep 5
done


sudo snappy install --allow-unauthenticated subutai_0.0.1_all.snap

issues.summary: Research a way to run subutai command without full path.
issues.description:
On resource host we need to have ability to execute command "subutai" with all additional arguments without setting full path every time. 
Find a way to execute commands in short form like "sudo subutai list". 
Commands should works with sudo.
issues.creator: dshihovtsev

issueWorkLogs.comment:
We could use following command to prevent setting fullpath for binaries: 
sudo bash -c "echo 'Defaults secure_path="/apps/subutai/current/bin:/apps/subutai-mng/current/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"' > /etc/sudoers.d/subutai"

as a distribution channel we tried to use

1) object storages tested: Riak S2, Ceph
                     this works good as backend to store snaps
2) tested handler to have minimal storage capacity with snaps
                     ended up with rewriting Kurjun
3) tested simple webserver(nginx) as way to distribute snaps in current situation
                    simple working way for to go till we get Kurjun up
4) tested Kurjun as a storage.

After communicationg to Kurjun team and sharing our Expirience with repo storage, it is been decided to add features to Kurjun ot use object storage as backend and provide unified API to be used as storage for snap packages

issueWorkLogs.comment:
talked  with snappy ubuntu community
Тема: Re: How to create local repository for Ubuntu Snappy

On Wed, Jul 22, 2015 at 08:06:51AM +0300, A A wrote:
> How to create local repository for Ubuntu Snappy  like with reprepro?

I think your options are:

- Upload to the Canonical store
- Ask Canonical to host a private store for you
- Sideload your snaps via some other mechanism

The latest news I've heard about this is in this thread:
https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/snappy-app-devel/2014-December/000030.html

Thanks

issueWorkLogs.comment:
Faced problem with Killing processes on CH when command execution timeout reached.
Using go-lxc package which provides go bindings to lxc libllxc API, where for command execution used RunCommand or RunCommandStatus which to not provide options to get link on pid or running command and we cannot terminate command until in ends.
As workaround for now used to run commands on CH prefixing it with timeout command like
"command timeout Command_to_execute args"
issueWorkLogs.author: bnuriddin

issueWorkLogs.comment: currently implemented work of command execution on CH with workaround "timeout  int $command". Chunk send working
